title: Fertilizer chemical risk assessment
text: installing latest release R package run following code :
code: # Enable repository from kwb-r options(repos = c(   kwbr = 'https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install kwb.fcr in R install.packages('kwb.fcr')  # Browse the kwb.fcr manual pages help(package = 'kwb.fcr')

title: Estimate the bio concentration factor in two different ways — BCF_regression

title: Estimate the bio concentration factor in two different ways — BCF_regression
text: constant Log constant linear Kd regression beta_ph, beta_org, beta_conc Log coefficient pH, organic carbon soil concentration log-linear Kd regression regType Chacter specifying way K_d value calculated. Either "direct" means regression directly leads sorption coefficient "indirect" means regression estimates concentration pore water sorption coefficient subsequently calculated quotient soil pore water concentration. pH pH value org_c Organic carbon content percent. conc Soil concentration mg/kg

what: PECs for soil, porewater and human consumption over a long period of time — longterm_PEC
title: PECs for soil, porewater and human consumption over a long period of time — longterm_PEC
text: Based input data provided Excel sheets, 3 different PECs calculated. number years number agricultural fields different properties (Number Monte Carlo cycles) can chosen.

title: PECs for soil, porewater and human consumption over a long period of time — longterm_PEC
code: longterm_PEC(   dat,   info,   years,   nFields,   use_mixing_factor = FALSE,   PNECwater_c_i = FALSE,   food_only = TRUE,   growing_period = 180,   t_res = 1,   traceBackVariables = FALSE,   keep_c_course = TRUE )

title: PECs for soil, porewater and human consumption over a long period of time — longterm_PEC
text: dat List input variables. list produced function read_fcr_input() Excel sheets. info table containing additional substance information loaded read_fcr_input() years Years fertilizer application nFields Number Monte Carlo cycles use_mixing_factor working yet! TRUE, porewater diluted pollutant free groundwater realistic estimation risks groundwater. However TGD approach assumes porewater = groundwater assessment. PNECwater_c_i TRUE, initial concentration soil derived RQ = 1 groundwater risk assessment (PEC_porewater = PNEC_porewater). Thus, inital concentration defined applied PNEC groundwater. food_only TRUE, predicted human consumption via food multiplied 2 compensate disregard water consumption growing_period Numeric value specifiyng number days plant growth t_res Temporal resolution days returned output matrix (effect calculation). default 1 (every day) can lead large output matrix. maximal reslution 365 days, since every year calculated seperately. traceBackVariables TRUE, variables every simulation year returned. Note: can lead large lists. keep_c_course FALSE, course concentration part output. case variabel t_res meaningless.

title: PECs for soil, porewater and human consumption over a long period of time — longterm_PEC
text: List table PEC types per year, table concentration course top soil predefined temporal resolution, optional: traceBackVariables TRUE: list distributed input variables year, traceBackVariables FALSE: Input variables first year including initial situations human consumption inital concentration porewater

what: Distribution derived by comparable circumstances — rderived
title: Distribution derived by comparable circumstances — rderived
text: function combines uniform distribution minimum maximum upper lower tail normal distribution.

title: Distribution derived by comparable circumstances — rderived
Distribution derived by comparable circumstances — rderived
text: n Number samples drawn min Minimum value normal comparables max Maximum value normal comparables Minimum distribution (Default -Inf)

title: Distribution derived by comparable circumstances — rderived
text: numeric vector length n randomly drawn values according distribution

title: Distribution derived by comparable circumstances — rderived
text: 95%, 2.5% 2.5% drawn values originate uniform distribution, lower tail, upper tail normal distribution, respectively. normal distribution characterized mean minimum maximum. standard deviation derived 2.5% 97.5% quantile definied minimum maximum values. (sd = (max - mean) / 1.959963) number Fields multiplied 38 uniform distribution, multiplied 1 tails normal distribution (38/40 = 95%). Finally, defined number fields randomly drawn vector.

what: Random samples from specified distribution — rdist
title: Random samples from specified distribution — rdist
text: Draw n samples uniform, normal, truncated normal (-> positive ), lognormal gamma distributions based two input values

title: Random samples from specified distribution — rdist
code: rdist(dist_name, value_1, value_2, n, shift = 0, seed = NULL)

title: Random samples from specified distribution — rdist
text: dist_name Character vector specifying Name distribution. Either "none", "uniform", "normal" "tnormal" (truncated), "lognormal", "gamma", "derived", "tderived" "logderived" value_1, value_2 Distribution parameters based dist_name:  "none": value_1 used constantvalue, value_2 used  "normal": value_1 mean, value_2 standard deviation  "tnormal": value_1 mean, value_2 standard deviation  "lognormal": value_1 log mean, value_2 standard log deviation (natural logarithms)  "gamma": value_1 shape, value_2 rate  "uniform": value_1 minimum, value_2 maximum  "derived": value_1 minimum uniform distribution, value_2 maximum uniform distribution. Uniform distribution accounts 95% data  "tderived": value_1 minimum uniform distribution, value_2 maximum uniform distribution. Uniform distribution accounts 95% data  "logderived": value_1 minimum log-uniform distribution, value_2 maximum log-uniform distribution (values log-scaled). Log-Uniform distribution accounts 95% data n Number samples drawn shift numeric value defining subsequent shift distribution default 0 (-> shift) seed numeric value set seed random selection. default NULL -> seed

title: Random samples from specified distribution — rdist
text: Numeric vector length n randomly drawn samples specified distribution

title: Random samples from specified distribution — rdist
text: values specified value_1 value_2 represent min max "uniform", mean standard deviation "normal" "tnormal", log mean log standard deviation (natural logarithm) "lognormal", shape rate "gamma". shift value especially interesting lognormal gamma distributions.

title: Read environmental and pollutant variables — read_fcr_input
Read environmental and pollutant variables — read_fcr_input
text: input_path Path folder "pollutants" "sites" contain input data excel sheets pollutantName Name Pollutant filename pollutant (prefix "_sheet.xslx) siteName Name site filename environment sheet (prefix "_sheet.xslx) fertilizerName Name fertilizer filename fertilizer sheet (prefix "_sheet.xslx). fertilizerName = "none", fertilizer application pollutant concentration set 0.

title: Read environmental and pollutant variables — read_fcr_input
text: List two items names "dat" "info" containing input variable data (information distribution type, distribution parameters, type variability unique variable ID) additional information simulate substance behavior.

title: Read environmental and pollutant variables — read_fcr_input
text: input files must path. pollutant excel files must named "'pollutantName'_sheet.xlsx". Furthermore, excel tables must number columns column names.

title: Log-Distribution derived by comparable circumstances — rlderived
text: 95%, 2.5% 2.5% drawn values originate log-uniform distribution, lower tail, upper tail log-normal distribution, respectively. log-normal distribution characterized mean log-minimum log-maximum. standard deviation derived 2.5% 97.5% quantile defined minimum maximum values. sd = (log10(max) - log10(mean)) / 1.959963 number Fields multiplied 38 uniform distribution, multiplied 1 tails log-normal distribution (38 / 40 = 95%) Finally, defined number fields randomly drawn vector.
